node.title: Woman who killed lottery winner backs bill keeping names secret
node.description: Dorice Donegan "Dee Dee" Moore is serving a life term in the 2009 shooting death of lottery winner Abraham Shakespeare.

node.title: Russian flights banned from U.S. airspace amid Ukraine invasion
node.description: The ban applies to Russian aircraft and airlines.

node.title: Russian oligarchs moving yachts as U.S. tracks down assets
node.description: Russian billionaires are moving their yachts as fears grow that the U.S. and its allies could seize their assets in response to the Ukraine invasion.

node.title: CBS News projects Abbott and O'Rourke win Texas primaries, will face off in November
node.description: One House Democrat faces his toughest primary yet and the GOP governor faced far-right challengers.

node.title: Kamala Harris on Ukraine-Russia conflict, voting rights and inflation
node.description: Vice President Kamala Harris believes there is "so much at stake" when it comes to the Russia-Ukraine crisis.

node.title: "Mystery" space junk to crash into moon at 5,800 mph on Friday
node.description: Scientists expect the object to carve out a hole up to 66 feet across and send moon dust flying hundreds of miles across the barren surface.

node.title: U.N. taking first step toward "historic" treaty on plastics pollution
node.description: Pact would target plastic pollution ranging from raw material phase to product design and use and disposal, including "epidemic" of plastic trash.

node.title: Cuellar and Cisneros head to runoff for Texas' 28th District
node.description: Cuellar, an incumbent since 2005, survives a primary challenge after having his home raided by the FBI in January.

node.title: Melinda French Gates opens up about divorce, "journey of healing"
node.description: Melinda and Bill were married for 27 years before announcing their split last May.

node.title: Gunman in Sacramento church shooting lived in the church, police say
node.description: Authorities identified David Mora as the man who killed his three daughters and their chaperone. Their mother had feared for the girls' safety, court documents show.

node.title: Hawaii to lift COVID quarantine requirement for travelers
node.description: Hawaii has one of the lowest coronavirus infection rates in the nation.

node.title: Biden uses State of the Union to push "unity agenda"
node.description: The president emphasized what unites the country while trying to reassure Americans worried about the Ukraine crisis, inflation and gas prices that "we are going to be OK."

node.title: Scott Peterson should "pay for killing" unborn son, ex-juror testifies
node.description: Richelle Nice also testified that she sent 17 handwritten letters to Peterson in prison nearly two decades ago.

node.title: Fitbit recalls 2 million Ionic smartwatches for burn hazard
node.description: San Francisco company has received 118 reports of burn injuries from batteries overheating, safety agency says.

node.title: Child marriage becomes a legal loophole in custody fights
node.description: It often only takes one parent to consent to let a 16- or 17-year-old child get married, and once that child is married custody agreements are moot.

node.title: Want to help people in Ukraine? Here are ways to donate
node.description: As the fighting intensifies, groups helping injured and needy civilians in Ukraine are appealing for help.

node.title: Former top Pentagon official weighs in on Putin's choices in Ukraine
node.description: "Intelligence Matters" host Michael Morell talks with Vickers about Putin's options, decision-making and how his pariah status will affect developments at home and abroad.

node.title: "Court debt" a steep barrier to a clean slate for ex-convicts
node.description: Only one U.S. state does not consider court debt in deciding if someone is eligible for record-clearing.

node.title: Ukraine's leader vows to hold fast as Putin's missiles rain down
node.description: As Russian forces plod toward Ukraine's capital, slowed by "logistical difficulties and strong Ukrainian resistance," President Zelensky says Putin is trying to "erase us all."

node.title: As it happened: Police pelted with bricks, three officers in hospital
node.description: Tents were set alight on Parliament grounds today, protesters clashed with police and three officers have been taken to hospital, after bricks were torn up and thrown at them.

node.title: Large tides, courier delays among obstacles at start of oyster season
node.description: It's been a bumpy opening for the new Bluff oyster season.

node.title: Child sex abuse operation: Level of offending much higher than before - investigator
node.description: DIA digital child exploitation team manager Tim Houston said the volume of cases had been much higher than in previous operations, but he was not sure if it was just the tip of an iceberg.

node.title: 'Sit, bow, turn, back, shake, stay, jump' - Lucky the sheep can do it all
node.description: Lucky is originally from a farm in Burke's Pass in South Canterbury and he knows a few tricks - in fact, he knows so many his owner needs a list to keep track of them all.

node.title: Fears border changes may burst domestic travel bubble
node.description: A Methven tourism operator fears the border opening may not result in the economic boom many are forecasting.

node.title: As it happened: Police move against Parliament protesters
node.description: Today's police actions against protesters on Parliament ground began early this morning. See how the events earlier today unfolded with RNZ's live updates.

node.title: Employment Court to consider injunction to stop health workers' strike
node.description: The Employment Court will tomorrow consider an injunction to stop a planned strike by thousands of health workers this Friday.

node.title: 'Largest ever' meth bust in NZ: Police, Customs seize 613kg of the drug
node.description: A shipment of 613 kilograms of methamphetamine - with what police say is a retail value of more than $245 million - was stopped at Auckland Airport last Thursday.

node.title: Australian PM tests positive for Covid-19
node.description: In a statement released late last night, Scott Morrison confirmed he took a PCR test after developing a fever on Tuesday evening.

node.title: Most speech watchers say State of the Union made them feel optimistic, proud - CBS News poll
node.description: More than half say the speech made them feel the coronavirus is mostly behind us

node.title: Biden uses State of the Union to call for focus on "burn pits"
node.description: "Veterans are the backbone and the spine of this country. They're the best of us," Mr. Biden said.
